intro: Perytis glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, blue-violet flower clusters that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Perytis glauca is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
